description: Construction of 17 x 2 storey and 2 x 3 storey affordable houses (8 x 2 bed, 7 x 3 bed and 4 x 4 bed) with car parking and private amenity space together with a main pedestrian and vehicular access from Javelin Way, a secondary pedestrian access; and provision of hard and soft landscaping, bicycle storage and boundary treatment (Deemed Consent Application by The London Borough Of Ealing)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The housing units hereby approved shall be made available for both first and subsequent occupiers only as social rent affordable housing that meets the definition of affordable housing in Annex B of PPS3 or any future guidance that replaces it.  Reason:  To ensure that the development contributes to the creation of a mixed community, in accordance with policies 3A.9 and 3A.11 of the London Plan (Consolidated with Alterations Since 2004) 2008. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details.  Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'Plan for the Environment'. | Details indicating the positions, appearance, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected on the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing to the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the residential units hereby approved. The development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details, which shall be completed before the residential units are first occupied and permanently retained thereafter.   Reason:  To protect the appearance of the area and the amenity of surrounding properties in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) ' Plan for the Environment' | Details of the hard and soft landscaping to be undertaken within the site shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the first occupation of any of the residential units hereby approved. The details as approved shall be laid out and planted within the first planting season following the commencement of the development or such other period as may be agreed in writing with the local planning authority. Any trees or plants which within 5 years of planting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced with others of the same size and species and in the same positions within the next planting season, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the local planning authority. This hard and soft landscaping shall be subject to a landscape management plan, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development. The landscaping shall thereafter be maintained and managed in accordance with the approved landscape management programme.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 3.2, 3.8, 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 9: Trees and Development Guidelines. | The dwellings shall achieve Level 4 of the Code for Sustainable Homes. No dwelling shall be occupied until a final Code Certificate has been issued for it certifying that Code Level 4 has been achieved.    Reason:  In the interests of sustainability and energy efficiency, in accordance with policy 2.1 of Ealing's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment' and policies 4A.1 and 4A.3 of London Plan (Consolidated with Alterations Since 2004) 2008. | Prior to commencement of development on the site, other than site remediation, a detailed final Energy Strategy based on either of the options contained within the documentation of the application hereby approved, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.    Reason:  In the interests of energy conservation, energy efficiency and renewable energy generation in the interests of the environment in accordance with Ealing's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment' policies 2.1 and 4.1 and London Plan policies 4A.1, 4A.2, 4.3, 4A.4, 4A.5, 4A.6 and 4A.7. | Prior to the commencement of the development, other than the site remediation, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for mitigation works to protect sensitive rooms from external noise. The criteria to be met and the assessment method shall be that specified at the Council's Environmental Health Department's Document 5.3 "Guidance for developers".  The works, as approved, shall be completed before occupation and thereafter permanently retained.  Reason: In the interests of the residential living conditions of future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.11 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration' and policy 3A.6 of the London Plan | The houses hereby approved shall be constructed to comply with Lifetime Homes standards.  Reason: To ensure that the housing units provide for the changing needs of the future occupiers, in accordance with policy 5.3 of Ealing's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment'. | The houses hereby approved for plot numbers 7 and 15 shall be constructed to Wheelchair Housing standards and specific measures shall be retained as such thereafter.  Reason:  To provide for the needs of people with disabilities, in accordance with policy 5.3 of Ealing's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment'. | Prior to commencement of development, a construction management strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Development shall proceed in accordance with the approved strategy.  Reason:  In the interests of the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policy 4.1 of Ealing's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment'. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E, F and G of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 as amended by the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) (No. 2) (England) Order 2008, or any subsequent Order revoking and re-enacting the provisions of that Order with or without modification, no development within the curtilage of a dwellinghouse other than that which forms part of the overall development hereby approved shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason:  To prevent the overdevelopment of the sites and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the buildings, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 4B.1 of the London Plan. | The car parking spaces and vehicle manoeuvring areas detailed on the application drawings hereby approved shall be laid out in accordance with the approved drawings and made available for use prior to the first occupation of the development, and retained as such thereafter.   Reason:  In the interests of highway safety and the residential amenity of future occupiers and neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 9.1 of Ealing's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment'. | Prior to the commencement of development, details of tree protection measures for all retained trees that are affected by the development shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority.  Measures shall be implemented prior to the commencement of any development on the site and retained until the development has been completed in accordance with the approved details, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the local planning authority.   Reason:  To ensure that the development does not cause detriment to the long term health of the retained trees on and adjoining the site, in accordance with policy 4.5 of Ealing's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | Prior to commencement of development on the site, details of a site contamination assessment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Any necessary remediation measures identified in the assessment shall be undertaken in full accordance with a scheme of remediation that shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development.     Reason : To ensure that any contamination from previous uses of the site will not result in detriment to the health of future and neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy 2.7 of  Ealing's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004 'Plan for the Environment'.
